Tutorials in Theoretical Chemistry

Register now!

About

Tutorials in Theoretical Chemistry

The 2017 Edition of the Tutorials in Theoretical Chemistry organized by the Université Paul Sabatier will be held in Luchon-Superbagnères, France, from the 23rd January to the 2nd February 2017.


These tutorials are focused in computer implementations, and numerical methods. The number of students is limited to 34.




This event is done in the frame of École des sciences avancées de Luchon the mirror web page is at http://www.quantware.ups-tlse.fr/ecoledeluchon/sessionwis2/.


Organising committee

  • Stefano Evangelisti
  • Thierry Leininger
  • Arjan Berger
  • Romuald Poteau
  • Nicolas Suaud
  • Jérôme Cuny

Register

How to proceed?



Deadlines

Note: The maximum number of students for this edition is limited to 34. In order to be considered, please take into account the following dates:

  • Registration : before 31st October, 2016 at 23:59:59 (GMT+1).
  • Payment/Inscription: before 30th November 2016 at 23:59:59 (GMT+1).



1) Registration

Use the registration form to request your inscription to the tutorials. For general inquiries please use the contact form.

2) Payment/Inscription

If you are accepted, you will get an email with instructions to pay the inscription fees (150€).

3) Confirmation

You have to send us back the payment invoice, and once we receive it your participation is confirmed.




Note: Registration fees cover: teaching, meals, accommodation, and travel from Toulouse Blagnac to Luchon-Superbagnères.

Venue

Luchon-Superbagnères (Ski resort at 1800m height)

The tutorials will take place in Luchon-Superbagnères in France. Bagnères-de-Luchon, also referred to as Luchon is an authentic mountain town in the Pyrenees at the southernmost point of the Haute-Garonne Department, stands at the heart of a majestic mountain setting. It is surrounded by the mountain ranges 13 most famous peaks, including Aneto, which is the highest peak in the Pyrenees (3,404m).





Important dates

We will meet at Blagnac Airport on 23rd January at 14:30 (GMT+1). A bus will take us roundtrip from the airport to the venue as shown below:

  • Departure from Blagnac Airport : 23rd January, 2017 at 14:30 (GMT+1)
  • Arrival to Blagnac Airport: 2nd February 2017 at 11:00 (GMT+1)

Program

TCCM Winter Tutorial Computational Tools for Theoretical Chemistry 2017

Topics

  • APT: Advanced programming techniques. (S. Evangelisti)
  • BNP: Geometry and Topology - Building Nanoparticles. (R. Poteau)
  • LDCS: Low-dimensional Carbon structures - the usefulness of simple approaches. (S. Evangelisti)
  • QM: Quantum Magnetism - the Heisenberg model. (N. Suaud)
  • QD: Quantum Dynamics. (A. Berger)
  • PES: Exploration of Potential Energy Surfaces. (J. Cuny)
  • PES: High Perfomance Computing - Parallel Computing. (A. Scemama)




Teachers

  • Arjan Berger (LCPQ)
  • Anthony Scemama (LCPQ)
  • Jérôme Cuny (LCPQ)
  • Stefano Evangelisti (LCPQ)
  • Romuald Poteau (LPCNO)
  • Nicolas Suaud (LCPQ)




  • LCPQ: Laboratoire de Chimique et Physique Quantiques; Université Paul Sabatier - Toulouse.
  • LPCNO: Laboratoire de Physique et Chimique des Nano-Objets; Université Paul Sabatier et INSA - Toulouse.

Luchon Activities

Luchon is a lively holiday destination that attracts hikers, spa-goers, skiers, white water sports enthusiasts, mountain-bikers and bicycle tourists throughout the year.

  • Client: LTTC
  • Date: January 2017
  • Service: winter

Superbagnères

Luchon Superbagnères (Haute-Garonne Department, 140km south of Toulouse) opens you the doors of the Pyrenees and invites you to discover its ski area located on a naturally sunny balcony where you can enjoy breathtaking views over the valley of Luchon and the Maladeta massif, including Aneto, which is the highest peak in the Pyrenees

  • Client:
  • Date: January 2017
  • Service: winter

Luchon, natural sites

Luchon have many beautiful places to explore by foot, bicycle, motorcycle, horseback and by car. 1) The Lys Valley is a wild valley worth exploring up to the impressive Cascade d’Enfer waterfall and beyond, to the Gouffre d’Enfer sinkhole. 2) The Lac d’Oô is a blue-green gem of a lake at 1,507 m, surrounded by stunning vertical rock faces and fed by a 275m waterfall. 3) The Hospice de France is in a spectacular setting of mountain pastures and forests. It is also an historic place that has been welcoming travellers and adventurers exploring the Pyrenees since the 17th century.

  • Client: LTTC
  • Date: January 2017
  • Service: winter
